So in 2021, I have pledged to do 300 days of yoga as part of my get healthier plan.  This is about my 5th or 6th Adriene 30 day series but it's been a a year or so since I've done any.   I'm not a religious or spiritual person in any way (no 3rd eye for me), meditation makes me anxious and angry and, physically, I could be the worst person at yoga ever (I'm over 50, I'm overweight, my heels have never touched the ground in downward dog, I swear my arms are too short as I can't even wrap them around my knees when on my back, I have arthritis in both knees and one thumb, and the only "crow" that will ever be in my life is the crow that I eat!) BUT I am so thankful for Adriene and these series as I can do them in the privacy of my own home and she never makes me feel like a yoga loser for what I can't do.  I've learned not to focus on what I can't do but to modify for what I can and at the end of every session, I find that I have improved, even if in the tiniest bit, in some form - breathing, flexibility, balance - SOMETHING.   By the end of a 30 day session (which honestly may take me 32-35 days) I feel better in my body and mind.  All of this to say, even if you don't think yoga is for you or that you can't do it...you CAN.   It may not be perfect, heck it may not even be pretty, but you will thank yourself in the long run.

Day 8:

It says some things about me that I waded through the first week of practice, in spite of aching muscles and poses I'd never seen before, and kept up every single day, and it's this kind self-care practice that I put off for an entire day instead.

It's been a long, hard, strange, terrible week, and I am being kind to myself this weekend. I'm glad to have had this. I'm glad to have brought myself to do it. I knew it would be warm and good and feel good to do, and I let it slide away for a day and a half because, well, I didn't need to push myself and force myself to do something that felt GOOD, did I? I only got myself to the mat by reminding myself that I wouldn't feel able to do the hard, important things if I didn't get through this nice one first.

The nice things are important too. This was worth my time, not just as a necessary unskippable step in the thirty days, but on its own merit. I'm glad to have done it.

Everyone else was on Day 9 today, but I'll do Day 9 tomorrow, and if I stay a day behind for the rest of the month so be it. I'm still not alone. Thousands of people are a day behind, or two days, or three. Thousands of people will find this sequence in the future, next week or next month or next year, and it will still be worth it. We all move at our own pace.

That's actually what made me begin doing yoga more regularly (that and my crazy stress LOL). Every person's body is different, but perhaps your knee pain is also caused by muscle tightness?
